tread.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to put your foot on or in something while you are walking
tread.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Sorry, did I tread on your foot?
She trod barefoot on the soft grass.
tread.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to press or crush something into the floor or ground with your feet
tread.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Stop treading mud all over my clean kitchen floor!
Bits of the broken vase got trodden into the carpet.
tread.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to crush grapes with your feet in order to produce juice for making wine
tread.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: David trod wearily along behind the others.
tread.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the pattern of lines on the part of a tyre that touches the road
tread.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: the part of a stair that you put your foot on
tread.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: the particular sound that someone makes when they walk
tread.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: I heard the back door bang, and Rexâ€™s tread in the hall.
